results.firPara: Never mind Will Griggs On Fire it was Thomas Müller lighting up Paris as Germany confirmed their advance to the second stage. How the Bayern Munich striker has failed to register a goal in Germanys three games to date is a mystery, for with a bit more luck he could have claimed the tournaments first hat-trick here.
results.secPara: Northern Ireland were glad he did not for, by virtue of keeping the score down against Germany, they were able to guarantee a last-16 spot thanks to Turkeys win against the Czech Republic a few hours later. Northern Irelands goal difference ended up superior to Turkeys by two so, as Michael McGoverns heroics in goal were chiefly responsible for that margin, it was no wonder he was feted at the end of the night.
results.webTitle: Northern Ireland progress after keeping Germany down to a single-goal win

results.firPara: Jakub Blaszczykowski came off the bench to score the winning goal and rubber-stamp Polands progress to the knockout stages, sending Ukraine home without a goal or a point
results.secPara: Jakub Blaszczykowski came off the bench to score the winning goal and rubber-stamp Polands progress to the knockout stages, sending Ukraine home without a goal or a point
results.webTitle: Ukraine 0-1 Poland: Euro 2016 – as it happened

results.firPara: Mario Gomezs first half goal ensured Germany would top Group C but it could easily have been half a dozen if not for Northern Irelands Michael McGovern, who had the game of his life

results.webTitle: Northern Ireland 0-1 Germany: Euro 2016 – as it happened!

results.firPara: Real Madrid have confirmed that they will exercise their buy-back clause for striker Álvaro Morata, with the European champions set to pay €30m (£23m) for the player they sold to Juventus in 2014 for €20m.
results.secPara: The 23-year-old, who has been linked with a move to Manchester United, Arsenal, Chelsea and Paris Saint-Germain, is currently part of the Spain squad at Euro 2016 and scored twice against Turkey last week. Madrid have long been expected to activate their clause after Morata scored 15 goals in Serie A during his two seasons with Juventus and a statement from the club on Tuesday confirmed that he will return to the club where he began his career.
results.webTitle: Real Madrid to activate buy-back clause for Álvaro Morata from Juventus

results.firPara: We will make someone pay for this. As post-match obiter dicta go, Roy Hodgsons attempt to instil some optimism after the goalless draw with Slovakia is not quite up there with We flippin murdered em – the affectionately mocked head coachs verdict after Englands cricketers drew with the mighty Zimbabwe in Bulawayo 20 years ago. Still, it might have been better for Hodgson to offer more of a dead bat in Saint-Étienne. The retort is obvious enough. Spot-on, Roy. Someone will pay. Most likely England in the quarter-finals against France in Paris. Whos picking up this tab? You are, Group B second-placers, you are.
results.secPara: Yet with a little distance there is a more moderate side to this. Even for those frustrated by Englands strangulated progress through a moderate group, the lack of grooved combinations, the selection so far of five different teams for six halves of football, there is still plenty of hope. Tournament football is a business of sudden tides and currents. England have started stodgily and finished well before. Group B is done, unlamented, a forgotten boredom, in Philip Larkins phrase (he was talking about Coventry). But the wheels are still turning. The ride goes on. After Coventry comes Nice and maybe even Paris.
results.webTitle: Roy Hodgson is right to water the green shoots for England at Euro 2016

results.firPara: Russias 3-0 loss to Wales and exit from Euro 2016 prompted angry reactions from officials and sardonic headlines and memes. Despite the teams heartfelt apologies, most were quick to blame the players, arguing they lacked international experience and motivation.
results.secPara: The goalkeeper Igor Akinfeev, whose quick hands prevented the Wales match from being even more of a train wreck for his side, and several other players went over to the Russian fans section at the end of the match to apologise for their performance.
results.webTitle: ‘The Russian team is soft – we need a Stalinist mobilisation,’ say communists
